intro: Boechera hoffmannii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are basal and rosette-like, often covered in a fine layer of hairs.
